newsitem.title: USA: Wash. nuclear unit at 55 pct due to power surplus.
newsitem.headline: Wash. nuclear unit at 55 pct due to power surplus.

text.p: The 1,158 megawatt (MW) WNP-2 nuclear power unit will operate at 55 percent of capacity until Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) requests additional power, a spokesman said Wednesday.
The federal power marketing agency has since January periodically asked the unit to trim output due to the wide availability of lower-cost hydropower.
"We are holding at that level day-by-day until BPA changes its request," the Washington Public Power Supply System spokesman said.
In addition, the unit's annual refueling outage will likely be moved up from the current April 18 start date because of the abundant hydropower resources, he noted.
BPA has indicated that the outage may begin mid-March or earlier, but final assessment of snowpack and spring runoff patterns is still underway, the spokesman said.
